meanings.definition: (verb) To flow or leak slowly in a thick, sticky manner.
meanings.sent1: The syrup began to ooze out of the bottle.
meanings.sent2: The honey will ooze down the sides of the jar.
meanings.sent3: The glue seemed to ooze out like a slow-moving river.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to ooze from every pore of her being.
meanings.sent5: The lava started to ooze from the volcano, creating a dangerous situation.
